definition: variant of 污衊|污蔑[wu1 mie4]

sentences.english: This is no doubt meant to slander and defile money.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑是对金钱的污蔑与栽赃。

sentences.english: F. I saw his video which is an embarrasment to the world of arch.
sentences.chinese: 我看过他的录像，简直是对考古学的污蔑。

sentences.english: She turned as red as a beetroot when they befouled her reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他们污蔑她时，她满脸绯红。

sentences.english: On the other side, there were those who branded them as the “curse” of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，又有人污蔑他们是这个国家的“祸根”。
有些则完全是污蔑性的。

sentences.english: The accusations, the persecution caused him so much financial and mental anguish.
sentences.chinese: 控告和污蔑带给他如此多的经济和精神上的痛苦。

sentences.english: Thanksgiving slander you, is that they let you know sweep before your own door.
sentences.chinese: 感恩污蔑你的人，是他们让你知道正人先正己。

definition: variant of 誣衊|诬蔑[wu1 mie4]
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to discredit/to defame/to smear sb's name/to bring shame upon (oneself or one's family etc)/to blacken (e.g. commando's face for camouflage)/to black out or obliterate (e.g. censored words)
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to speak off the cuff/to casually opine
to spit blood (idiom); venomous slander/malicious attacks
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
